Package com.sinch.xms

Class ApiConnection

java.lang.Object
com.sinch.xms.ApiConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
@Immutable(copy=false)
public abstract class ApiConnection
extends Object
implements Closeable
An abstract representation of an XMS connection. This class exposes a number of methods which can be called to interact with the XMS REST API.

To instantiate this class it is necessary to use a builder, see builder(). The builder can be used to configure the connection as necessary, once the connection is opened with ApiConnection.Builder.start() or start() it is necessary to later close the connection using close().

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  ApiConnection.Builder
    A builder of API connections.

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_ENDPOINT

      public static final URI DEFAULT_ENDPOINT
      The default endpoint of this API connection.

  • Method Details

    • builder

      @Nonnull public static ApiConnection.Builder builder()
      Returns a fresh builder of API connections.
      Returns:
      a non-null connection builder

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts up this API connection. This must be called before performing any API calls.

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Closes this API connection and releases associated resources.

      Note, this will not shut down the HTTP client if the API connection was initialized with a custom http client.

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
      Throws:
      IOException
      See Also:
      Closeable.close()

    • token

      public abstract String token()
      The XMS authentication token.
      Returns:
      a non-null string

    • servicePlanId

      public abstract String servicePlanId()
      The XMS service plan identifier.
      Returns:
      a non-null string

    • prettyPrintJson

      @Default public boolean prettyPrintJson()
      Whether the JSON sent to the server should be printed with indentation. Default is to not pretty print.
      Returns:
      true if pretty printing is enabled; false otherwise

    • httpClient

      @Default public org.apache.http.nio.client.HttpAsyncClient httpClient()
      The HTTP client used by this connection. The default client is a minimal one that does not support, for example, authentication or redirects.

      Note, when this API connection is closed then this HTTP client is also closed only if the default HTTP client is used. That is, if ApiConnectionImpl.Builder.httpClient(HttpAsyncClient) was used to initialize using an external HttpAsyncClient then this client must also be started up and shut down externally.

      Returns:
      a non-null HTTP client

    • callbackWrapper

      @Default public CallbackWrapper callbackWrapper()
      The future callback wrapper to use in all API calls. By default this is CallbackWrapper.exceptionDropper, that is, any exception thrown in a given callback is logged and dropped.
      Returns:
      a non-null callback wrapper

    • endpoint

      @Default public URI endpoint()
      The base endpoint of the XMS API. This specifies the HTTP host and base path that will be used in sending requests to XMS. The URL should not contain query or fragment components.
      Returns:
      a non-null URL

    • createBatch

      public MtBatchTextSmsResult createBatch​(MtBatchTextSmsCreate sms) throws InterruptedException, ApiException
      Creates the given batch and schedules it for submission. If MtBatchSmsCreate.sendAt() returns null then the batch submission will begin immediately.

      This method blocks until the request completes and its use is discouraged. Please consider using the asynchronous method createBatchAsync(MtBatchTextSmsCreate, FutureCallback) instead.

      Parameters:
      sms - the batch to create
      Returns:
      a batch creation result
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting
      ApiException - if an error occurred while communicating with XMS

    • createBatchAsync

      public Future<MtBatchTextSmsResult> createBatchAsync​(MtBatchTextSmsCreate sms, org.apache.http.concurrent.FutureCallback<MtBatchTextSmsResult> callback)
      Asynchronously creates the given text batch and schedules it for submission. If MtBatchSmsCreate.sendAt() returns null then the batch submission will begin immediately.
      Parameters:
      sms - the batch to create
      callback - a callback that is invoked when batch is created
      Returns:
      a future whose result is the creation response

    • replaceBatch

      public MtBatchTextSmsResult replaceBatch​(BatchId id, MtBatchTextSmsCreate sms) throws InterruptedException, ApiException
      Replaces the batch with the given identifier. After this method completes the batch will match the provided batch description.

      This method blocks until the request completes and its use is discouraged. Please consider using the asynchronous method replaceBatchAsync(BatchId, MtBatchTextSmsCreate, FutureCallback) instead.

      Parameters:
      id - identifier of the batch to replace
      sms - the batch description
      Returns:
      a batch submission result
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting
      ApiException - if an error occurred while communicating with XMS

    • replaceBatchAsync

      Asynchronously replaces the batch with the given identifier. On completion, the batch will match the provided batch description.
      Parameters:
      id - identifier of the batch to replace
      sms - the new batch description
      callback - a callback that is invoked when replace is completed
      Returns:
      a future whose result is the creation response

    • updateBatchAsync

      public Future<MtBatchTextSmsResult> updateBatchAsync​(BatchId batchId, MtBatchTextSmsUpdate sms, org.apache.http.concurrent.FutureCallback<MtBatchTextSmsResult> callback)
      Asynchronously updates the text batch with the given batch ID. The batch is updated to match the given update object.
      Parameters:
      batchId - the batch that should be updated
      sms - description of the desired update
      callback - called at call success, failure, or cancellation
      Returns:
      a future containing the updated batch

    • createBatchDryRun

      public MtBatchDryRunResult createBatchDryRun​(MtBatchSmsCreate sms, Boolean perRecipient, Integer numRecipients) throws InterruptedException, ApiException
      Attempts to perform a dry run of the given batch.

      This method blocks until the request completes and its use is discouraged. Please consider using the asynchronous method createBatchDryRunAsync(MtBatchSmsCreate, Boolean, Integer, FutureCallback) instead.

      Parameters:
      sms - the batch to dry run
      perRecipient - whether the per-recipient result should be populated
      numRecipients - the number of recipients to populate
      Returns:
      a dry run result
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting
      ApiException - if an error occurred while communicating with XMS

    • createBatchDryRunAsync

      public Future<MtBatchDryRunResult> createBatchDryRunAsync​(MtBatchSmsCreate sms, Boolean perRecipient, Integer numRecipients, org.apache.http.concurrent.FutureCallback<MtBatchDryRunResult> callback)
      Asynchronously performs a dry run of the given batch.
      Parameters:
      sms - the batch to dry run
      perRecipient - whether the per-recipient result should be populated
      numRecipients - the number of recipients to populate
      callback - a callback that is invoked when dry run is complete
      Returns:
      a future whose result is the dry run result

    • createGroupAsync

      public Future<GroupResult> createGroupAsync​(GroupCreate group, org.apache.http.concurrent.FutureCallback<GroupResult> callback)
      Asynchronously creates the given group.
      Parameters:
      group - the group to create
      callback - a callback that is invoked when creation is completed
      Returns:
      a future whose result is the creation response

      public GroupResult fetchGroup​(GroupId id) throws InterruptedException, ApiException

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the fetched group
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting
